body_html:
My concern with that is, someone can just `bazel build tensorflow/something/to/build` and then use it. Then denormals will fail. Would it be possible to do something like this for denormals: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/lib/hash/crc32c_accelerate.cc#L23
…
On Wed, Feb 8, 2017 at 8:42 AM, Martin Wicke ***@***.***> wrote: We can enable sse3. I suggest we do that not hidden away in an unoverridable file, but in bazel rc. Ideally by setting the optimization flags for our builds to -msse3. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#7349 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AHlCOZonysJ3QzSe7bNJTNyPCy5FFUhOks5rafB5gaJpZM4L6RQ2> .

My concern with that is, someone can just `bazel build
tensorflow/something/to/build` and then use it.
Then denormals will fail.
Would it be possible to do something like this for denormals:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/lib/hash/crc32c_accelerate.cc#L23

…
On Wed, Feb 8, 2017 at 8:42 AM, Martin Wicke ***@***.***> wrote:
 We can enable sse3. I suggest we do that not hidden away in an
 unoverridable file, but in bazel rc. Ideally by setting the optimization
 flags for our builds to -msse3.

body:
My concern with that is, someone can just `bazel build
tensorflow/something/to/build` and then use it.
Then denormals will fail.
Would it be possible to do something like this for denormals:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/lib/hash/crc32c_accelerate.cc#L23

On Wed, Feb 8, 2017 at 8:42 AM, Martin Wicke <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> We can enable sse3. I suggest we do that not hidden away in an
> unoverridable file, but in bazel rc. Ideally by setting the optimization
> flags for our builds to -msse3.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/7349#issuecomment-278383228>,

> .
